issue.title: Application starter template breaks on start

repository.name: merchant-center-application-kit
repository.description: Tools and components for developing Merchant Center Customizations üõ†

issue.body: **Describe the bug** Application starter template throws an error **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Install the template using `create-mc-app` 2. Start the application 3. The browser opens with an error **Expected behavior** The application starter should render without errors

repository.name: merchant-center-application-kit
repository.description: Tools and components for developing Merchant Center Customizations üõ†

body: Thanks for the report, @unindented. The purpose of [using `eval` indirectly](http://www.ecma-international.org/ecma-262/5.1/#sec-10.4.2) here is to get a reference to the global object. I'll try another method and cut a new beta release.
BTW, does anyone know what CSP Codesandbox actually uses?

Thanks for fixing that! üíØ

One small thing to clarify: it‚Äôs not just about codesandbox in particular but any app that uses a CSP in development mode.

Anyway, thanks again for looking into that ü§ó

The fix for this was just [released in 4.4.0-beta.8](https://github.com/ReactTraining/react-router/releases/tag/v4.4.0-beta.8). Please give it a shot.

@emmenko You can still use CSP with `eval`, you just have to include `'unsafe-eval'`
@mjackson verified on my app, this is working perfectly. Thank you!
